Annotation.String: This resource is used to obtain or modify the network services managed by a given manager.
This object shall be used to represent the network service settings for the manager.
Manager Network Protocol resources can be updated to change the protocol and virtual media settings and other writable properties.
The DNS Host Name of this manager, without any domain information.
The value of this property shall contain the host name without any domain information.
This is the fully qualified domain name for the manager obtained by DNS including the host name and top-level domain name.
The value of this property shall contain the fully qualified domain name for the manager.
Settings for this Manager's HTTP protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the HTTP protocol settings for the manager. The default value of the Port property should be 80 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's HTTPS protocol support.

This object shall contain information for the HTTPS/SSL protocol settings for this manager. The default value of the Port property should be 443 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's SNMP support.
This object shall contain information for the SNMP protocol settings for this manager. The default value of the Port property should be 161 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's Virtual Media support.
This object shall contain information for the Virtual Media protocol settings for this manager. The value of the Port property shall contain the TCP port assigned for Virtual Media usage.
Settings for this Manager's Telnet protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the Telnet protocol settings for this manager. The default value of the Port property should be 23 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's SSDP support.

This object shall contain information for the SSDP protocol settings for this manager. Simple Service Discovery Protocol (SSDP) is for network discovery of devices supporting the Redfish service. The default value of the Port property should be 1900 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's IPMI-over-LAN protocol support.

This object shall contain information for the IPMI over LAN protocol settings for the manager. The default value of the Port property should be 623 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's SSH (Secure Shell) protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the SSH protocol settings for the manager. The default value of the Port property should be 22 for compatibility with established client implementations.
Settings for this Manager's KVM-IP protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the KVM-IP (Keyboard, Video, Mouse) protocol settings for the manager.
This property describes the status and health of the resource and its children.
This property shall contain any status or health properties of the resource.
Settings for a network protocol associated with a manager.
This type shall describe information about a protocol setting for a manager.
Indicates if the protocol is enabled or disabled.
The value of this property shall contain the enabled status of the protocol. The value shall be true if enabled and false if disabled.
Indicates the protocol port.
The value of this property shall contain the port assigned for the protocol.
Indicates how often the Multicast is done from this service for SSDP.

The value of this property shall contain the time interval, in seconds, between transmissions of the multicast NOTIFY ALIVE message. A setting of 0 seconds shall disable this functionality. The recommended value is 600 seconds.
Indicates the time to live hop count for SSDPs Notify messages.
The value of this property shall contain the Time-To-Live hop count used for multicast NOTIFY messages. The recommended value is 2.
Indicates the scope for the IPv6 Notify messages for SSDP.
The value of this property shall contain the IPv6 scope used for multicast NOTIFY messages. The valid enumerations are a subset of the available IPv6 Scope types.
SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Link scope.
SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Site scope.
SSDP Notify messages are sent to addresses in the IPv6 Local Organization scope.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.
This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number.
Settings for this Manager's DHCPv4 protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the DHCPv4 protocol settings for the manager.
This version was created to show annotations in previous namespaces were updated.

This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number. It was also created to clarify that the DHCP property is for DHCPv4.
Settings for this Manager's NTP protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the NTP protocol settings for the manager.
The available actions for this resource.
The Actions property shall contain the available actions for this resource.
Indicates to which NTP servers this manager is subscribed.
The value of this property shall contain all the NTP servers for which this manager is using to obtain time.
The available actions for this resource.
This type shall contain the available actions for this resource.
This property contains the available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This property shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.
The available OEM specific actions for this resource.
This type shall contain any additional OEM actions for this resource.

This version was created to force the regeneration of JSON Schema so that OData properties are marked as required, and integer properties are marked as integer rather than number. It was also created to clarify that the DHCP property is for DHCPv4.
Settings for this Manager's DHCPv6 protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the DHCPv6 protocol settings for the manager.
Settings for this Manager's Remote Desktop Protocol support.
This object shall contain information for the Remote Desktop Protocol settings for the manager.
Settings for this Manager's Remote Frame Buffer protocol support, which can be used to support VNC.
This object shall contain information for the Remote Frame Buffer protocol settings for the manager.
This is a reference to a collection of certificates used for HTTPS by this manager.
The value of this property shall be a link to a collection of type CertificateCollection.
